attributes.action: Help for single parent working families not claiming universal credit.
attributes.additional_details: If you own your own house and are working you am not entitled to any benefits, so therefore working home owners are not entitled to help with their child care costs, due to 63p off every pound being deducted on any earnings over £409.
attributes.background:
Help with child care costs for single parent families not entitled to universal credit due to owning their own house. No 15 free child care hours for 2 year olds due to working and not claiming benefits. 
1 incoming coming in and entitled to nothing.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the UK Government or Parliament to do.

You can find out about the benefits currently available to single parents here:

https://www.singleparents.org.uk/information/benefits/financial-support-for-single-parents

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the UK Government or Parliament to do.
